node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

node.name: Overgrow
node.effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

species.description:
There is a plant seed on its back right from the
day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly
grows larger.

While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are
stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.
species.name: Bulbasaur

node.name: Overgrow
node.effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

species.description:
When the bulb on its back grows large, it
appears to lose the ability to stand on its
hind legs.

Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength.
Sunlight also makes the bud on its back
grow larger.
species.name: Ivysaur

node.name: Overgrow
node.effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

species.description:
Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar
energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower.
The fragrance becalms those engaged
in a battle.
species.name: Venusaur

node.name: Solar Power
node.effect: Increases Special Attack to 1.5× but costs 1/8 max HP after each turn during strong sunlight.

node.name: Blaze
node.effect: Strengthens fire moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

species.description:
It has a preference for hot things. When it rains,
steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip
of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to
go out.
species.name: Charmander

node.name: Blaze
node.effect: Strengthens fire moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Solar Power
node.effect: Increases Special Attack to 1.5× but costs 1/8 max HP after each turn during strong sunlight.

species.description:
It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its
fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts
intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
species.name: Charmeleon

node.name: Solar Power
node.effect: Increases Special Attack to 1.5× but costs 1/8 max HP after each turn during strong sunlight.

node.name: Blaze
node.effect: Strengthens fire moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

species.description:
It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders.
It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an
altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very
high temperatures.
species.name: Charizard

node.name: Torrent
node.effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Rain Dish
node.effect: Heals for 1/16 max HP after each turn during rain.

species.description:
When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it
squirts out water with vigorous force.

When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside
its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
species.name: Squirtle

node.name: Torrent
node.effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Rain Dish
node.effect: Heals for 1/16 max HP after each turn during rain.

species.description:
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its
shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to
maintain its balance while swimming.
species.name: Wartortle

node.name: Torrent
node.effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

node.name: Rain Dish
node.effect: Heals for 1/16 max HP after each turn during rain.

species.description:
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause
fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water
capable of punching holes through thick steel.
species.name: Blastoise

node.name: Run Away
node.effect: Ensures success fleeing from wild battles.

node.name: Shield Dust
node.effect: Protects against incoming moves' extra effects.

species.description:
For protection, it releases a horrible stench from
the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that
enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
species.name: Caterpie

node.name: Shed Skin
node.effect: Has a 33% chance of curing any major status ailment after each turn.

species.description:
It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this
stage, it can only harden, so it remains
motionless to avoid attack.

Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell,
the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a
harsh attack.
species.name: Metapod

node.name: Tinted Lens
node.effect: Doubles damage inflicted with not-very-effective moves.

node.name: Compound Eyes
node.effect: Increases moves' accuracy to 1.3×.

species.description:
In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to
release highly toxic dust into the air.

It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto
the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
species.name: Butterfree

node.name: Static
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of paralyzing attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Lightning Rod
node.effect: Redirects single-target electric moves to this Pokémon where possible.  Absorbs Electric moves, raising Special Attack one stage.

species.description:
Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity
have cheek sacs that are extra soft and
super stretchy.

When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails
together and exchange electricity through them
as a form of greeting.
species.name: Pikachu

node.effect: Redirects single-target electric moves to this Pokémon where possible.  Absorbs Electric moves, raising Special Attack one stage.

node.name: Lightning Rod
node.effect: Redirects single-target electric moves to this Pokémon where possible.  Absorbs Electric moves, raising Special Attack one stage.

species.description:
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself
from its own high-voltage power.

If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail
to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
species.name: Raichu

node.name: Surge Surfer
node.effect: Doubles this Pokémon's Speed on Electric Terrain.

species.description:
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself
from its own high-voltage power.

If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail
to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
species.name: Raichu

node.name: Sand Veil
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

node.name: Sand Rush
node.effect: Doubles Speed during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

species.description:
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas.
By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt
and moisture clinging to its body.

It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If
hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp
claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
species.name: Sandshrew

node.name: Snow Cloak
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during hail.  Protects against hail damage.

node.name: Slush Rush
node.effect: During Hail, this Pokémon has double Speed.

species.description:
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas.
By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt
and moisture clinging to its body.

It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If
hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp
claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
species.name: Sandshrew

node.name: Sand Veil
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

node.name: Sand Rush
node.effect: Doubles Speed during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

species.description:
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder
and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel
when touched.

It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
species.name: Sandslash

node.name: Snow Cloak
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during hail.  Protects against hail damage.

node.name: Slush Rush
node.effect: During Hail, this Pokémon has double Speed.

species.description:
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder
and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel
when touched.

It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
species.name: Sandslash

node.name: Hustle
node.effect: Strengthens physical moves to inflict 1.5× damage, but decreases their accuracy to 0.8×.

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

species.description:
Females are more sensitive to smells than males.
While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check
wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat
berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a
bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
species.name: Nidoran♀

node.name: Hustle
node.effect: Strengthens physical moves to inflict 1.5× damage, but decreases their accuracy to 0.8×.

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

species.description:
The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought
that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get
poked while their mother is feeding them.

If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will
band together to assault enemies with a chorus
of ultrasonic waves.
species.name: Nidorina

node.name: Sheer Force
node.effect: Strengthens moves with extra effects to 1.3× their power, but prevents their extra effects.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

species.description:
Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense.
With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield
its children from any kind of attack.

It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps
between the spines on its back. The spines will
never secrete poison while young are present.
species.name: Nidoqueen

node.name: Hustle
node.effect: Strengthens physical moves to inflict 1.5× damage, but decreases their accuracy to 0.8×.

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

species.description:
The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains
a powerful poison. This is a very cautious
Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its
ground and even risk its life in battle to protect
the female it’s friendly with.
species.name: Nidoran♂

node.name: Hustle
node.effect: Strengthens physical moves to inflict 1.5× damage, but decreases their accuracy to 0.8×.

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

species.description:
With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this
Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it
searches for a moon stone.

It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively.
The potency of its poison increases along with
the level of adrenaline present in its body.
species.name: Nidorino

node.name: Rivalry
node.effect: Increases damage inflicted to 1.25× against Pokémon of the same gender, but decreases damage to 0.75× against the opposite gender.

node.name: Poison Point
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Sheer Force
node.effect: Strengthens moves with extra effects to 1.3× their power, but prevents their extra effects.

species.description:
When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to
control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s
lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful
and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail
and diamond-crushing horn.
species.name: Nidoking

node.name: Friend Guard
node.effect: Decreases all direct damage taken by friendly Pokémon to 0.75×.

node.name: Cute Charm
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of infatuating attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Magic Guard
node.effect: Protects against damage not directly caused by a move.

species.description:
It is said that happiness will come to those who
see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a
full moon.

Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular.
However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
species.name: Clefairy

node.name: Magic Guard
node.effect: Protects against damage not directly caused by a move.

node.name: Cute Charm
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of infatuating attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Unaware
node.effect: Ignores other Pokémon's stat modifiers for damage and accuracy calculation.

species.description:
A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will
run and hide the moment it senses people.

Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin
drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually
found in quiet places.
species.name: Clefable

node.name: Flash Fire
node.effect: Protects against fire moves.  Once one has been blocked, the Pokémon's own Fire moves inflict 1.5× damage until it leaves battle.

node.name: Drought
node.effect: Summons strong sunlight that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

species.description:
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it
grows, several new tails are sprouted.

As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous.
When held, it feels slightly warm.
species.name: Vulpix

node.name: Snow Cloak
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during hail.  Protects against hail damage.

node.name: Snow Warning
node.effect: Summons hail that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

species.description:
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it
grows, several new tails are sprouted.

As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous.
When held, it feels slightly warm.
species.name: Vulpix

node.name: Flash Fire
node.effect: Protects against fire moves.  Once one has been blocked, the Pokémon's own Fire moves inflict 1.5× damage until it leaves battle.

node.name: Drought
node.effect: Summons strong sunlight that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

species.description:
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails
is loaded with supernatural powers.

Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of
its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
species.name: Ninetales

node.name: Snow Warning
node.effect: Summons hail that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

node.name: Snow Cloak
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during hail.  Protects against hail damage.

species.description:
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails
is loaded with supernatural powers.

Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of
its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
species.name: Ninetales

node.name: Cute Charm
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of infatuating attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Friend Guard
node.effect: Decreases all direct damage taken by friendly Pokémon to 0.75×.

node.name: Competitive
node.effect: Raises Special Attack by two stages upon having any stat lowered.

species.description:
Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by
comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop
singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.

By freely changing the wavelength of its voice,
Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to
make any listener sleepy.
species.name: Jigglypuff

node.name: Cute Charm
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of infatuating attacking Pokémon on contact.

node.name: Frisk
node.effect: Reveals an opponent's held item upon entering battle.

node.name: Competitive
node.effect: Raises Special Attack by two stages upon having any stat lowered.

species.description:
The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If
opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate
itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.

It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate.
In particular, the curl on its forehead has a
texture that’s perfectly heavenly.
species.name: Wigglytuff

node.name: Inner Focus
node.effect: Prevents flinching.

node.name: Infiltrator
node.effect: Bypasses light screen, reflect, and safeguard.

species.description:
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check
its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies
around with skill.

Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light
won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together
to keep each other warm as they sleep.
species.name: Zubat

node.name: Inner Focus
node.effect: Prevents flinching.

node.name: Infiltrator
node.effect: Bypasses light screen, reflect, and safeguard.

species.description:
It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said
that if it finds others of its kind going hungry,
it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully.
It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its
fangs and slurping up blood.
species.name: Golbat

node.name: Run Away
node.effect: Ensures success fleeing from wild battles.

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

species.description:
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move.
It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

During the day, it stays in the cold underground
to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
species.name: Oddish

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

node.name: Stench
node.effect: Has a 10% chance of making target Pokémon flinch with each hit.

species.description:
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor.
The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance
of 1.25 miles.

What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey.
It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
species.name: Gloom

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

node.name: Effect Spore
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of inflcting either paralysis, poison, or sleep on attacking Pokémon on contact.

species.description:
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step,
the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it
contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
species.name: Vileplume

node.name: Sand Veil
node.effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

node.name: Sand Force
node.effect: Strengthens rock, ground, and steel moves to 1.3× their power during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

node.name: Arena Trap
node.effect: Prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out.  Eluded by flying-types and Pokémon in the air.

species.description:
If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil
perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth.
It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy
to spot.
species.name: Diglett

node.effect: Strengthens rock, ground, and steel moves to 1.3× their power during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

species.description:
A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge
earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea
level. No one knows what it’s like underground.
species.name: Dugtrio

species.description:
It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good
mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look
at its hoard of treasures.

It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on
its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with
Galarian Meowth.
species.name: Meowth

species.description:
Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you
takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the
moment it gets annoyed.

Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that
of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship
between the two is one of mutual disdain.
species.name: Persian

species.description:
Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you
takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the
moment it gets annoyed.

Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that
of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship
between the two is one of mutual disdain.
species.name: Persian

node.name: Cloud Nine
node.effect: Negates all effects of weather, but does not prevent the weather itself.

species.description:
Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the
Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently
the pain subsides for a while.

As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets
progressively worse. It uses intense psychic
energy to overwhelm those around it.
species.name: Psyduck

node.name: Cloud Nine
node.effect: Negates all effects of weather, but does not prevent the weather itself.

node.name: Swift Swim
node.effect: Doubles Speed during rain.

node.name: Damp
node.effect: Prevents self destruct, explosion, and aftermath from working while the Pokémon is in battle.

species.description:
This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It
paddles through the water with its long limbs,
putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that
defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into
the water and taken away.
species.name: Golduck

node.name: Flash Fire
node.effect: Protects against fire moves.  Once one has been blocked, the Pokémon's own Fire moves inflict 1.5× damage until it leaves battle.

node.name: Intimidate
node.effect: Lowers opponents' Attack one stage upon entering battle.

node.name: Justified
node.effect: Raises Attack one stage upon taking damage from a dark move.

species.description:
It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly
stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any
opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.
species.name: Growlithe

node.name: Intimidate
node.effect: Lowers opponents' Attack one stage upon entering battle.

node.name: Flash Fire
node.effect: Protects against fire moves.  Once one has been blocked, the Pokémon's own Fire moves inflict 1.5× damage until it leaves battle.

node.effect: Raises Attack one stage upon taking damage from a dark move.

species.description:
The sight of it running over 6,200 miles
in a single day and night has captivated
many people.

A Pokémon that has long been admired for its
beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
species.name: Arcanine

node.name: Swift Swim
node.effect: Doubles Speed during rain.

node.name: Water Absorb
node.effect: Absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

node.name: Damp
node.effect: Prevents self destruct, explosion, and aftermath from working while the Pokémon is in battle.

species.description:
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.
The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of
the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will
cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act
like a suction cup.
species.name: Poliwag

node.name: Damp
node.effect: Prevents self destruct, explosion, and aftermath from working while the Pokémon is in battle.

node.name: Water Absorb
node.effect: Absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

node.name: Swift Swim
node.effect: Doubles Speed during rain.

species.description:
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.
This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of
lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When
captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’
grasp and escape.
species.name: Poliwhirl

node.name: Damp
node.effect: Prevents self destruct, explosion, and aftermath from working while the Pokémon is in battle.

node.name: Swift Swim
node.effect: Doubles Speed during rain.

node.name: Water Absorb
node.effect: Absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

species.description:
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through
cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to
smash through drift ice and plow forward.

Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial
arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out
powerful punches.
species.name: Poliwrath

node.name: Inner Focus
node.effect: Prevents flinching.

node.name: Synchronize
node.effect: Copies burns, paralysis, and poison received onto the Pokémon that inflicted them.

node.name: Magic Guard
node.effect: Protects against damage not directly caused by a move.

species.description:
This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it
sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the
powers that the Pokémon wields.

Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently
the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its
teleportations go.
species.name: Abra

node.effect: Copies burns, paralysis, and poison received onto the Pokémon that inflicted them.

node.name: Inner Focus
node.effect: Prevents flinching.

species.description:
Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it
sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful.
To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up
psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
species.name: Kadabra

species.description:
It has an incredibly high level of intelligence.
Some say that Alakazam remembers everything
that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said
that this Pokémon used these powers to create
the spoons it holds.
species.name: Alakazam

node.name: Steadfast
node.effect: Raises Speed one stage upon flinching.

node.name: Guts
node.effect: Increases Attack to 1.5× with a major status ailment.

node.name: No Guard
node.effect: Ensures all moves used by and against the Pokémon hit.

species.description:
Its whole body is composed of muscles.
Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can
hurl 100 grown-ups.

Always brimming with power, it passes time by
lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
species.name: Machop

node.name: No Guard
node.effect: Ensures all moves used by and against the Pokémon hit.

node.name: Guts
node.effect: Increases Attack to 1.5× with a major status ailment.

node.name: Steadfast
node.effect: Raises Speed one stage upon flinching.

species.description:
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a
power-save belt to be able to regulate
its motions.

Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps
people by doing work such as the moving of
heavy goods.
species.name: Machoke

node.name: Guts

node.effect: Ensures all moves used by and against the Pokémon hit.

node.name: Steadfast
node.effect: Raises Speed one stage upon flinching.

species.description:
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its
opponents with ceaseless punches and chops
from all angles.

With four arms that react more quickly than it
can think, it can execute many punches at once.
species.name: Machamp

node.effect: Prevents stats from being lowered by other Pokémon.

node.name: Rain Dish
node.effect: Heals for 1/16 max HP after each turn during rain.

species.description:
Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer.
It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it
searches for prey.

This Pokémon is mostly made of water.
A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to
spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
species.name: Tentacool

species.description:
When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow
brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to
fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely.
Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out
tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
species.name: Tentacruel

species.description:
It can’t run properly when it’s newly born.
As it races around with others of its kind,
its legs grow stronger.

If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning
mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
species.name: Ponyta

If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning
mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

species.description:
This Pokémon can be seen galloping through
fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane
fluttering in the wind.

The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it
decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.
species.name: Rapidash

species.description:
Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t
feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice
when its tail grows back, either.

When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water,
sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait
to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
species.name: Slowpoke

Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t
feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice
when its tail grows back, either.

When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water,
sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait
to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
species.name: Slowpoke

node.name: Own Tempo

species.description:
Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit
on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail
make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon
into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go,
it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
species.name: Slowbro

into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go,

species.name: Slowbro

species.description:
At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and
ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a
grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it
emits electromagnetic waves from the units on
each side of its body.
species.name: Magnemite

node.name: Analytic
node.effect: Strengthens moves to 1.3× their power when moving last.

species.description:
This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have
linked together. Magneton sends out powerful
radio waves to study its surroundings.

This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful
magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when
a Magneton approaches.
species.name: Magneton

node.name: Inner Focus
node.effect: Prevents flinching.

node.name: Keen Eye
node.effect: Prevents accuracy from being lowered.

node.name: Defiant
node.effect: Raises Attack two stages upon having any stat lowered.

species.description:
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves
as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all
of them use it in the same way. Several distinct
styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
species.name: Farfetch’d

node.effect: Lets the Pokémon's normal and fighting moves hit ghost Pokémon.

node.name: Steadfast
node.effect: Raises Speed one stage upon flinching.

as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all
of them use it in the same way. Several distinct
styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
species.name: Farfetch’d

node.name: Skill Link
node.effect: Extends two-to-five-hit moves and triple kick to their full length every time.

node.name: Overcoat
node.effect: Protects against damage from weather.

node.name: Shell Armor
node.effect: Protects against critical hits.

species.description:
It swims facing backward by opening and closing
its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is
vulnerable only when its shell is open.
species.name: Shellder

node.name: Skill Link

node.name: Overcoat
node.effect: Protects against damage from weather.

node.name: Shell Armor
node.effect: Protects against critical hits.

species.description:
Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered,
even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it
is attacking.

Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to
open, even by those with superior strength.
species.name: Cloyster

node.name: Levitate
node.effect: Evades ground moves.

species.description:
Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed
by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place
it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
species.name: Gastly

node.name: Levitate
node.effect: Evades ground moves.

species.description:
Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim
starts shaking constantly until death
eventually comes.

If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness
when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
species.name: Haunter

node.name: Cursed Body
node.effect: Has a 30% chance of Disabling any move that hits the Pokémon.

species.description:
On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on
their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.

It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the
lives of those who become lost in mountains.
species.name: Gengar

node.name: Rock Head
node.effect: Protects against recoil damage.

node.effect: Raises Speed and lowers Defense by one stage each upon being hit by a physical move.

species.description:
As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many
hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by
squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
species.name: Onix

node.name: Hyper Cutter
node.effect: Prevents Attack from being lowered by other Pokémon.

node.name: Shell Armor
node.effect: Protects against critical hits.

node.name: Sheer Force
node.effect: Strengthens moves with extra effects to 1.3× their power, but prevents their extra effects.

species.description:
It can be found near the sea. The large pincers
grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself
with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
species.name: Krabby

node.name: Shell Armor
node.effect: Protects against critical hits.

node.name: Sheer Force
node.effect: Strengthens moves with extra effects to 1.3× their power, but prevents their extra effects.

node.name: Hyper Cutter
node.effect: Prevents Attack from being lowered by other Pokémon.

species.description:
Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower
strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy
to move.

Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s
not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
species.name: Kingler

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

node.name: Harvest
node.effect: Has a 50% chance of restoring a used Berry after each turn if the Pokémon has held no items in the meantime.

species.description:
Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs,
it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates
with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a
group of six. The minute even one member of the
group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
species.name: Exeggcute

node.name: Harvest
node.effect: Has a 50% chance of restoring a used Berry after each turn if the Pokémon has held no items in the meantime.

node.name: Chlorophyll
node.effect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

species.description:
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking
different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be
very interested in one another.

When they work together, Exeggutor’s three
heads can put out powerful psychic energy.
Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
species.name: Exeggutor

node.effect: Has a 50% chance of restoring a used Berry after each turn if the Pokémon has held no items in the meantime.

Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
